data.title: Recognized Chapters - Fraternity & Sorority Life
data.text:
Recognized Chapters

NATIONAL PAN-HELLENIC COUNCIL

The National Pan-Hellenic Council (NPHC) serves to further unite and promote the mission of historically African American (Black) Greek-lettered sororities and fraternities at Stockton University. These organizations, known as "The Divine Nine" promote community awareness and action through educational, cultural and philanthropic activities among the members, the Greek community, and the university.

UNIFIED CULTURAL GREEK COUNCIL

The Unified Cultural Greek Council (UCGC) serves as the programming body for culturally based Greek-lettered sororities and fraternities at Stockton University (historically Latinx, Asian, South-Asian and multicultural). The UCGC’s purpose is to inspire culture, trust, support, understanding, and friendship between its members, the Greek community and the university.

INTERFRATERNITY COUNCIL

The Interfraternity Council (IFC) is the programming body for all of Stockton University’s general fraternities. Consisting of elected executive officers and one representative from each respective fraternity, the council establishes and coordinates all recruitment activities, motivates and supervises academic achievement, governs the actions of its member chapters, and promotes community service projects throughout the year.

COLLEGE PANHELLENIC COUNCIL

The College Panhellenic Council (CPH) serves as the programming council to the national sororities at Stockton University. The council is responsible for promoting positive relations between sororities, coordinating council-wide activities, formal recruitment, informal recruitment.

PROFESSIONAL FRATERNITY COUNCIL

The Professional Fraternity Council serves as a convening body for the professional/co-ed/special interest fraternities and sororities at Stockton University. The Council is responsible for promoting the professional interests of its member chapters, coordinating association-wide activities and recruitment activities.
